task_prefix: Chess endgame dataset representing King+Rook versus King+Pawn positions. Contains 3,196 chess positions where White (with King and Rook) faces Black (with King and Pawn on a7, one square from promotion). The task is to classify whether White can force a win or if the position is drawn/lost. Each example contains 36 features. Predict the target class.

column_descriptions.bkblk: Black king is blocked from moving to certain squares
column_descriptions.bknwy: Black king is not in white's way to the promotion square
column_descriptions.bkon8: Black king is positioned on the 8th rank
column_descriptions.bkona: Black king is positioned on the a-file
column_descriptions.bkspr: Black king has spare moves or space to maneuver
column_descriptions.bkxbq: Black king attacks a bishop or queen square (likely a key square)
column_descriptions.bkxcr: Black king attacks a castle/corner square or the rook
column_descriptions.bkxwp: Black king would attack a white pawn (hypothetical as white has no pawn)
column_descriptions.blxwp: Black attacks white pawn (hypothetical positional feature)
column_descriptions.cntxt: Context or control feature capturing positional characteristics
column_descriptions.dwipd: Distance with interposed piece or doubled pieces
column_descriptions.hdchk: Position had a check in the recent move sequence
column_descriptions.katri: King attack triangle - zone-based encoding of king positions
column_descriptions.mulch: Multiple checks are possible in the position
column_descriptions.qxmsq: A queen would attack a marked square (theoretical feature)
column_descriptions.r2ar8: Rook can attack the 8th rank in 2 moves
column_descriptions.reskd: Rook restricts the enemy king's defensive options
column_descriptions.reskr: Rook restricts king or rook movement patterns
column_descriptions.rimmx: Rook has immediate maximum activity or range
column_descriptions.rkxwp: Rook attacks a white pawn square
column_descriptions.rxmsq: Rook attacks a marked square (likely promotion-related)
column_descriptions.skach: A skewer attack with check is possible
column_descriptions.skewr: A skewer tactic is present in the position
column_descriptions.skrxp: A skewer allows the rook to attack the pawn
column_descriptions.spcop: Space or copy operation - likely related to king maneuvering space
column_descriptions.thrsk: There is a threat of skewer in the position
column_descriptions.wkna8: White king is near the a8 promotion square
column_descriptions.wknck: White king is near check positions or corner
column_descriptions.wkovl: White king controls an oval or zone of squares
column_descriptions.wkpos: White king has a favorable position
column_descriptions.wtoeg: White can reach the edge or escape to safety

class_description: Classes: 'won' (White can force a win from this position - the rook and king can stop the pawn and checkmate), 'nowin' (White cannot win - Black's pawn will promote or the position is drawn)
